Decreases the reference count by one, deallocating the item if needed. 

In case the item is deallocated, the reference count of any dependent items is adjusted accordingly in a recursive manner.

Definition at line 18 of file common.\-c.

\hypertarget{common_8h_a327dce45c1cb680953555290dba8e35b}{\index{common.\-h@{common.\-h}!cbor\-\_\-move@{cbor\-\_\-move}}
\index{cbor\-\_\-move@{cbor\-\_\-move}!common.h@{common.\-h}}
\subsubsection[{cbor\-\_\-move}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf cbor\-\_\-item\-\_\-t}$\ast$ cbor\-\_\-move (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf cbor\-\_\-item\-\_\-t} $\ast$}]{item}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{common_8h_a327dce45c1cb680953555290dba8e35b}


Provide C\-P\-P-\/like move construct. 

Decreases the reference count by one, but does not deallocate the item even if it reach zero. This is useful for passing intermediate values to functions that increase reference count, Should only be used with functions that {\ttfamily incref} their arguments. \begin{DoxyVerb}embed:rst:leading-asterisk
* .. warning:: If the item is moved without correctly increasing the reference count afterwards, the memory will be leaked.
* \end{DoxyVerb}



\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em item\mbox{[}take\mbox{]}} & the item \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
the item with reference count decreased by one 
\end{DoxyReturn}


Definition at line 184 of file common.\-c.

\hypertarget{common_8h_ab27dda20ad909cebaee1b2f43e676f2c}{\index{common.\-h@{common.\-h}!cbor\-\_\-refcount@{cbor\-\_\-refcount}}
\index{cbor\-\_\-refcount@{cbor\-\_\-refcount}!common.h@{common.\-h}}

\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{common_8h_ab27dda20ad909cebaee1b2f43e676f2c}

\begin{DoxyVerb}embed:rst:leading-asterisk

\hypertarget{common_8h_a3f9f1d527374dbb4b48ef3fafa92e0bf}{\index{common.\-h@{common.\-h}!cbor\-\_\-set\-\_\-allocs@{cbor\-\_\-set\-\_\-allocs}}

\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf \-\_\-cbor\-\_\-malloc\-\_\-t}}]{custom\-\_\-malloc, }
\item[{{\bf \-\_\-cbor\-\_\-realloc\-\_\-t}}]{custom\-\_\-realloc, }

\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{common_8h_a3f9f1d527374dbb4b48ef3fafa92e0bf}


Sets the memory management routines to use. 

Only available when C\-B\-O\-R\-\_\-\-C\-U\-S\-T\-O\-M\-\_\-\-A\-L\-L\-O\-C is defined

\begin{DoxyVerb}embed:rst:leading-asterisk
* .. warning:: This function modifies the global state and should therefore be used accordingly. Changing the memory handlers while allocated items exist will result in a ``free``/``malloc`` mismatch. This function is not thread safe with respect to both itself and all the other *libcbor* functions that work with the heap.
* .. note:: `realloc` implementation must correctly support `NULL` reallocation
* \end{DoxyVerb}



\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em custom\-\_\-malloc} & malloc implementation \\
\hline
{\em custom\-\_\-realloc} & realloc implementation \\
\hline
{\em custom\-\_\-free} & free implementation \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
